name: Sight Casting for Redfish
description: An intentional and visual technique for casting to redfish you can see, often in shallow flats.
steps: Stand elevated or wade slowly to scan for redfish tails or movement.
Spot fish before casting — lead the fish by several feet.
Cast softly and let the lure sink naturally.
Twitch slowly and observe fish reaction — avoid overworking the lure.
Set the hook with patience after visual confirmation of the strike.
commonMistakes: Casting directly on top of the fish and spooking it.
Moving too quickly or creating surface disturbance.
Pulling the lure too fast, reducing realism.
journalPrompt: Have you ever been so focused that the world went quiet? What conditions allowed that awareness?
tairoGuidance: Let the water teach you before you cast. The fish may be seen — but your focus must be still enough to become invisible.
whisper: To see clearly, you must first become transparent. The redfish does not react to sound — it reacts to presence.
